sec.title: Mary Thompson-Hall
sec.p: is a program specialist at the International START Secretariat in Washington, DC where she manages START’s activities for the Adaptation at Scale in Semi-Arid Regions (ASSAR) project, part of the broader Collaborative Adaptation Research Initiative in Africa and Asia (CARIAA). Previously, she worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the Basque Center for Climate Change (BC3) on the topic of agrobiodiversity and adaptation to climate change. Her research interests include climate change adaptation in Sub-Saharan Africa, conservation and development, and exploring intersectional social difference in relation to adaptation.

sec.title: Unai Pascual
sec.p: is Ikerbasque Research Professor at the Basque Centre for Climate Change (BC3) and a Visiting Fellow at the University of Cambridge. He is an ecological economist with 20 years experience bridging the social and natural sciences for understanding complex social–ecological systems. His main research focuses on the interconnectedness between global environmental change and economic development paying special attention to the evolutionary role of institutions, markets, and environmental governance across scales. He has conducted research projects in many countries around the world, including Europe, the USA, and in developing countries such as Mexico, Peru, Bolivia, Colombia, India, Ethiopia, and Malawi.
